text:
GDP can be calculated as the sum of all the spending on newly produced goods and
services, or as the sum of the income received as a result of producing these goods and
services. Under the expenditure approach, GDP is calculated by summing the amounts
spent on goods and services produced during the period. Under the income approach,
GDP is calculated by summing the amounts earned by households and companies
during the period, including wage income, interest income, and business profits.
